title: Contingency Analysis
description: The EMS continuously simulates single-point-of-failure scenarios (contingencies) to ensure the grid would remain stable if a major piece of equipment failed.

tasks.description: Using the state estimator's model of the grid, simulate the outage of the first transmission line in a predefined list.
tasks.expected_outcome: System runs a power flow for the N-1 condition.

tasks.description: Check the simulation results for any thermal (overload) or voltage violations.
tasks.expected_outcome: System finds no violations for this contingency.

tasks.description: Repeat the process for every other major transmission line and generator on the system.
tasks.expected_outcome: System cycles through all contingencies and flags one that would cause a thermal overload.

tasks.description: Alert the system operator to the potential violation so they can take pre-emptive action.
tasks.expected_outcome: System generates an alarm for the operator about the potential insecure state.
